protocol_name: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
protocol_name_html: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
description: Protocol for resuspending viruses from soils and sediments.
before_start:
Preparations

  • AKC Buffer (Make before and store at 4°C)
  • “Amended K-citrate”: 1% K-citrate + 10% PBS + 5 mM EDTA (don’t add if doing DNase) + 150 mM MgSO4; (per Liter: 10g of k-citrate, 1.44g of Na2HPO4 *7H2O, and 0.24g of KH2PO4 brought to pH 7)
  • 1% BSA (w/v) in PBS
  • Need 2 ml per Amicon filter. Prepare 1% BSA (w/v) in PBS.
  • DNase
  • CsCl Density gradients
  • Weigh out sample in 50 ml centrifuge tubes
manuscript_citation:
• Trubl, G., Solonenko, N., Chittick, L., Solonenko, S.A., Rich, V.I. and Sullivan, M.B., 2016. Optimization of viral resuspension methods for carbon-rich soils along a permafrost thaw gradient. PeerJ, 4, p.e1999. 
  • Thurber, R.V., Haynes, M., Breitbart, M., Wegley, L., and Rohwer, F., 2009. Laboratory procedures to generate viral metagenomes. Nature Protocols, 4(4), pp.470-483.

 

More protocols on www.protocols.io under Dr. Matthew Sullivan's lab
guidelines:
• Need to record how much buffer is collected for viral counts
  • During the manual shaking, make sure the sample is broken up
  • If you can’t do the CsCl gradients or you lose too much biomass from it, then you can try and replace it with DNase
  • The more new tubes the samples touch, the greater the viral loss will be
  • For the Amicon step, try not to use new filters. The filters will slowly get clogged and it may take a while depending on how many contaminants (e.g. organics) there are. Using new filters will increase viral loss. The same concept applies to the 0.2 µM filters. The composition of the filter may affect viral recovery.
  • For the DNA extraction, use the Qiagen PowerSoil DNA extraction kit
  • Need to do Swift library prep. If you want quantitative samples that have both ssDNA and dsDNA viruses
  • If you don’t care about ssDNA viruses, then get rid of the 1.30 g/cm3 density layer. Add the 1.5 ml to the other layers; there will be some contamination in the 1.3 layer (See Thurber et al. 2009_Laboratory procedures to generate viral metagenomes)
  • I have outlined areas where you can stop (store in 4°C overnight)
  • This protocol does not include EDTA in the AKC buffer. EDTA interferes with DNase and it mainly used to chelate metals. Don’t add unless you have high metal contamination
  • Ultracentrifugation at 24,000 rpm for at least 2 hours (longer for better separation)

components.data: DNase samples or skip if you do CsCl purification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: DNase samples or skip if you do CsCl purification.

components.data: Incubate 2 ml of 1% BSA on Amicon filter for 1 hour
components.name: Description

components.data: Centrifuge filters at 1,000 g for 10 min (or until all BSA filters through) .
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge filters at 1,000 g for 10 min (or until all BSA filters through) .

components.data: Wash filters by centrifuging filters with 2 ml 1x PBS at 1,000g for 10 min (or until all PBS is filtered through).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash filters by centrifuging filters with 2 ml 1x PBS at 1,000g for 10 min (or until all PBS is filtered through).

components.data: Concentrate samples with Amicon filters (to ~5ml for CsCl purification).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate samples with Amicon filters (to ~5ml for CsCl purification).
Store at 4°C overnight.

components.data: CsCl protocol (need ultracentrifuge; SW41 bucket; major viral loss step; some viruses sensitive to CsCl, see Thurber et al. 2009)
components.name: Description

source_data.protocol_name: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
source_data.protocol_name_html: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
source_data.annotation:
Use densities:

  1. 20 g/cm3 (1.2) density layer is 1.0 ml (microbial cells)
  2. 30 g/cm3 (1.3) density layer is 1.5 ml (for ssDNA viruses)
  3. 40 g/cm3 (1.4) density layer is 1.5 ml (for ssDNA & some dsDNA viruses)
  4. 50 g/cm3  (1.5)density layer is 1.5 ml (dsDNA viruses)
  5. 65 g/cm3 (1.65) density layer is 1.0 ml (DNA and other contaminants)
source_data.thread_text:

  4. 50 g/cm3  (1.5)density layer is 1.5 ml (dsDNA viruses)
  5. 65 g/cm3 (1.65) density layer is 1.0 ml (DNA and other contaminants)

  1. 20 g/cm3 (1.2) density layer is 1.0 ml (microbial cells)
  2. 30 g/cm3 (1.3) density layer is 1.5 ml (for ssDNA viruses)
  3. 40 g/cm3 (1.4) density layer is 1.5 ml (for ssDNA & some dsDNA viruses)
  4. 50 g/cm3  (1.5)density layer is 1.5 ml (dsDNA viruses)

components.name: Description

components.data: Check microbial contamination with qPCR 16S analyses (~3 µl).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check microbial contamination with qPCR 16S analyses (~3 µl).

components.data: Quantify DNA with PicoGreen or Qubit (~2 µl).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quantify DNA with PicoGreen or Qubit (~2 µl).
NanoDrop for DNA purity (~2 µl).

components.data: You need 50 µl for shearing if you're using Swift kit (for ssDNA viruses; otherwise Nextera XT for dsDNA viruses).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: You need 50 µl for shearing if you're using Swift kit (for ssDNA viruses; otherwise Nextera XT for dsDNA viruses).

components.data: If you need to resize the DNA you can use AMPure beads (same ones that are used in the Swift kit) or a Pippin prep.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If you need to resize the DNA you can use AMPure beads (same ones that are used in the Swift kit) or a Pippin prep.
Shake manually for 30 s at 4°C.
Shake manually for 30 s at 4°C.

components.data: DNA extraction using PowerSoil DNA extraction kit; you don’t need the beads, but still use the bead solution; do alternative heat lysis
components.name: Description
